Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Rosaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.; Jobson, P.C.
source.title: Rosaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A.; Jobson, P.C. (1996). Rosaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Most leaves less than 3 cm long
Most leaves more than 3 cm long
Leaves 20–35 mm long, upper surface glabrescent, shiny, veins conspicuous; flowers pinkish; fruit bright orange-red
Leaves 12–25 mm long, upper surface glabrous, dull, veins inconspicuous; flowers white; fruit dull red
Flowers usually in 3s, short-pedicelled; leaves 17–36 mm long; shrub to c. 2 m high or more; branches more or less erect
Flowers usually 1–2 together, subsessile; leaves 5–14 mm long; shrub to c. 0.5 m high; branches spreading almost horizontally
Leaves elliptic, ovate or obovate, leaf length to width ratio c. 2, rarely more than 60 mm long
Leaves narrowly elliptic, oblong or obovate, leaf length to width ratio c. 2.5 or more, mostly more than 60 mm long
